borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions:
<p style="">The proposed development, by reasons of its depth, scale and proximity to neighbouring dwellings, will result in&nbsp;<span style="font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;">unacceptable impact on the living conditions of
neighbouring properties, particularly to No. 30 Wren Gardens in regards to a
loss of outlook, daylight and increased overshadowing, overbearing and a sense
of enclosure and to No. 32 Wren Gardens in regards to a loss of outlook and
increased overbearing and sense of enclosure, contrary to</span>:</p><p class="MsoNormal" style=""><span style="background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; line-height: 14.98px;">- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019)<br>- Policies&nbsp;3.5, 7.1, 7.4, and 7.6&nbsp;&nbsp;of The London Plan (March 2016)<br>- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Borough Wide DPD (March 2011)<br>- Policies DMD1 and DMD6 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19 Consultation version, October 2020).<br>- Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD (February 2012</span><span style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51); background: rgb(245, 245, 245); font-size: 10.5pt; line-height: 14.98px; font-family: Helvetica, sans-serif;">)</span></p>

<p style="">The proposed development, by reasons of introducing an uncharacteristic and unsympathetic addition of an unacceptable scale and design, with a flat roof, fails to complement or reflect the character and appearance of the host dwelling, terrace and the wider Becontree Estate. The location of the dwelling house within the Becontree Estate adds further weight to the harm caused by the discordant addition, contrary to:</p><p class="MsoNormal" style="">- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019)<br>- Policies 7.1, 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of The London Plan (March 2016)<br>- Policies HC1, D1 and D4 of the Draft London Plan (December 2019)<br>- Policies CP2 and CP3 of the Core Strategy DPD (July 2010)<br>- Policies BP2, BP5 and BP11 of the Borough Wide DPD (March 2011)<br>- Policies SP2, SPP6, DMD1, DMNE3, DMD4 and DMD6 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19 Consultation version, October 2020).<br>- Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD (February 2012)</p>
description: Construction of  First Floor Rear Extension
